answers.answer: It could be something and it could mean nothing. This is where it important to have a Neurologist interpret it. Try to hold tight until you talk to a Neurologist. It is easy to read into these reports and get worried when it may be okay.I know from experience you can get truly upset over trying to figure these reports out. My first Neurologist took a new job and sent me the report with out seeing me. I drove myself nuts because it talked about the brain stem and I decided it was really bad.The next MRI and that lesion had disappeared.Hang in there. Sounds like your PCP is looking out for you.Alex

question: I am a 40 yr old female with PMH of fibromyalgia. I have had a lot of strange neuro symptoms the last few months: numbness, tingling, memory loss, migraines, blurred vision, severe depression, personality changes, ringing in ears, etc... Was referred to a neurologist. Neuro exam quoted as "normal". Labs and MRI brain and c-spine orderd. Phone call from nurse two weeks later: Vit D was very low at 8.2. Was started on 50,000u 3x week for that. Was told that can cause a lot of "weird neuro stuff". Was told MRI was "fine". No follow-up appt ordered. Follow up with primary physician. Saw PCP the next week. He ordered MRI images and reports from the hospital. He is very concerned about MRI results. Wants me to see another neurologist. Here is what the brain MRI showed: "Small punctate foci of abnormal signal in the deep white matter of both cerebral hemispheres- most likely minimal old small vessel ischemic changes. Were not present on previous study in 2001. Two small 5mm diameter rounded structures are noted in the right and left parotid glands and most likely represent small lymph nodes. These are unchanged from previous study." I am only 40, have no history of hypertension, diabetes, CAD, etc. What does all this mean and should I be concerned for anything like MS or something like that?? I am very worried and confused. HELP!!!
title: MRI results...confused, worried!
